video.fontmanager



struct FontRenderer;
Used by VideoDriver implementations to draw a string.

uint height();
Return height of the font we're drawing.

void start();
Start drawing a string.

bool has_glyph(dchar c);
Determines if glyph for the specified character is loaded.

Params:
dchar c Character to check for.

Returns:
True if the glyph is loaded, false otherwise.

void load_glyph(VideoDriver driver, dchar c);
Load glyph for specified character.

Will render the glyph and create a texture for it.

Params:
VideoDriver driver Video driver to use for texture creation.
dchar c Character to load glyph for.

Texture* glyph(dchar c, out Vector2u offset);
Get texture, offset (relative to string start) to draw a character at.

Vector2u text_size(string text);
Get size of text as it would be drawn in pixels.

Params:
string text Text to get size of.

Returns:
Size of the text in X and Y. Y might be slightly imprecise.

class FontManager;
Handles all font resources.

void unload_textures(VideoDriver driver);
Delete all glyph textures from the video driver.

Params:
VideoDriver driver VideoDriver to unload textures from.

void reload_textures(VideoDriver driver);
Load glyph textures back to the video driver.

Params:
VideoDriver driver VideoDriver to load textures to.

void die();
Destroy the FontManager.

To destroy all FontManager resources, unload_textures must be called first.

Params:
driver Video driver used to delete glyph textures.

void font(string font_name, bool force_load = false);
Set font to use. force_load will set font (load if needed) immediately.

void font_size(uint size, bool force_load = false);
Set font size to use. force_load will set font (load if needed) immediately.

FontRenderer renderer();
Return renderer to draw text with.

bool antialiasing();
Return bool specifying whether or not font antialiasing is enabled.

bool kerning();
Return bool specifying whether or not kerning is enabled.
